newsitem.title: USA: ConEd sees approval for market-based rates.
newsitem.headline: ConEd sees approval for market-based rates.

text.p: Consolidated Edison Co of New York Inc (ConEd) said Monday it expects Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) approval next month allowing its marketing unit to sell bulk electricity at market-based rates.
"We expect to get approval in early February," said ConEd spokesman Michael Spall.
ConEd filed the request December 9 for Megawatt-Hour Store, its marketing subsidiary.
Currently, ConEd is restricted to buying and selling electricity at cost-based rates.
Cost-based rates are set by FERC tariffs at the incremental cost of power plus a small but guaranteed profit.
"With approval of this FERC filing, we expect to enlarge our trading activities to a larger geographic area, and provide better deals," said Ken Bekman, head of the Megawatt-Hour Store.
